definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: So, naturally, I took to running and jumping.
sentences.chinese: 由此，我很自然地从事了跑步和跳远。

sentences.english: He hurt his left ankle in the broad jump.
The younger fellows were to compete in the running brood jump.
sentences.chinese: 小伙子们呢，要比赛急行跳远。

sentences.english: He is best at long jump in our class.
sentences.chinese: 他在我们班最擅长跳远。

sentences.english: The speed of approach of the long-jump is closely related to the achievement.
sentences.chinese: 跳远的助跑速度与跳远成绩密切相关。

sentences.english: The speed of approach of the long-jump is closely related to the achievement.
sentences.chinese: 跳远的助跑速度与跳远成绩密切相关。

sentences.english: I especially love the long jump and the high jump.
sentences.chinese: 我尤其喜欢跳远和跳高。

sentences.english: What's more, there exists early phenomenon in the juvenile long-jump training in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 此外，上海市青少年跳远训练中存在早期化现象。

sentences.english: Another student won a gold medal in the long jump.
sentences.chinese: 另外一个学生则赢得了跳远的金牌。

sentences.english: The slowness and quickness of the run-up in long-jump mainly depends on the utilization rate of speed.
sentences.chinese: 跳远助跑的快慢较大程度取决于速度利用率的大小。

sentences.english: This class we will learn the full long-jump technique.
sentences.chinese: 这节课我们将学习完整的跳远技术。

sentences.english: Jack's gone in for the long-jump, but I don't think he has a chance to win.
sentences.chinese: 杰克参加跳远比赛去了，但我想他获胜机会甚微。

sentences.english: How does the jumper measure his approach run?
sentences.chinese: 跳远的关键技术是助跑。

sentences.english: The most critical part is the run-up.
sentences.chinese: 跳远的关键技术是助跑。
